oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dug relics from a tavern at Newsom's Station, Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A tavern operated in Newsom's Station, near current day Bellevue, Tennessee, from the 1790s to the 1830s. Artifacts recovered from the site include civilian coin buttons of various sizes, smal lead pistol balls, coins and "bits" of coins, pre-Civil War military buttons, a jaw harp, a pistol barrel, and pistol and rifle flints. The tavern was located along the Charlotte Pike which connected Nashville with Charlotte, the county seat of Dickson County, Tennessee.
oai_dc:dc.dc:format: Tools and equipment; Weapons and ammunition; Furnishings
